Dear Mrs. Newman:
Thank you very much for your letter regarding HR 673 proposing
the Public Television Act of 1967.
I deeply appreciate your having taken the time to bring to
my attention the facts and information contained in your
letter. This is indeed most helpful to me as I study this
legislation which is presently pending before the House
Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce. I realize
the importance of the matter to you, and it is good to learn
of the effectiveness that has been realized through the media
of educational radio and television.
This is a matter to which I wish to give very careful and
thorough consideration. I believe that every precaution that
can be made to prevent the Federal government becoming too
closely involved with these communication media should receive
every due consideration. I want to give very careful study to
these proposals and am grateful for the opinion which you have
related to me.
